results.title: The Youth who wanted to shiver
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow, Acton Films and Bosustow Entertainment

video_links.name: The Youth who wanted to shiver

results.brief_description: An animated adaptation of the classic fairy tale by the Brothers Grimm, about Jack who knows no fear and wants to be able to shiver. All help fails until his bride pours a bucket of tiny fish over him.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow, Acton Films and Bosustow Entertainment

results.title: The Secondary Teacher
results.creator_credit: E.J. Perry and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Describes the life of secondary student teachers in training: accommodation in a boarding house in Armadale, Victoria, for those from the country areas; Melbourne University and the various courses available for students. Also gives details about specialised couses and shows classes in progress. Shows the science, commerce, music and engineering faculties. Narrated by Terry Dear and animation by the Owen Brothers.

results.title: Billabong
results.brief_description: Set among the red gums, this film captures the mood of one day on the Murray River, Echuca, Victoria. Shows where thousands of birds come to breed each year.

results.title: Seeds of change
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Examines changes in Victorian farm life documenting its evolution from horse to tractor to modern machinery. Filmed on location at Jeparit, this program uses period re-creation and documentary footage.

results.title: Autumn days
results.brief_description: Shows without commentary some of the special features of autumn and how people prepare themselves for the cold weather ahead. It covers typical autumn activities, the turning of the leaves, harvesting of apples, and autumn in the country. Suitable for lower primary level.
results.description: Shows without commentary some of the special features of autumn and how people prepare themselves for the cold weather ahead. It covers typical autumn activities, the turning of the leaves, harvesting of apples, and autumn in the country. Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: Getting the message
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Dramatization of the difficulties faced by an illiterate adult in employment and social situations. Suggests that with concern and adequate teaching methods this problem can be overcome. The film highlights the plight of the hundreds of illiterate Australian adults.

results.title: Curriculum by Technology
results.creator_credit: Brendan Kenworthy, Bendigo Education Resource Centre, TV Ed Productions and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Shows how Bendigo Education Resource Centre is introducing new technology into distance education to increase the range of curriculum subjects offered for Year 11 and 12 students in isolated schoolos in the Mallee area: Telepaks, telephone links, fax machines, Macintosh computers, lessons on VHS tapes. Introduction by Justin Shortal.

results.title: Going outside: to play, to imagine, to learn
results.creator_credit: Rick Cavaggion and Open College of Further Education (S. Aust.)
results.brief_description: Outlines ways in which teachers can develop children’s awareness of the natural environment. In a bush setting, five to eleven-year-olds role play the Dam Conflict Game, learning how to become involved in an issue and how to communicate their feelings.

results.title: Two Australias
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Examines income distribution in Australia, comparing the attitudes of some wealthy and successful business people with those on social security benefits.
